text: Fibrinogen activates NF-kappa B transcription factors in mononuclear phagocytes .
Adhesion to extracellular matrices is known to modulate leukocyte activation , although the mechanisms are not fully understood .

Mononuclear phagocytes are exposed to fibrinous provisional matrix throughout migration into inflammatory foci , so this study was undertaken to determine whether fibrinogen triggers activation of NF-kappa B transcription factors .

U937 cells differentiated with PMA in nonadherent culture were shown to express two fibrinogen - binding integrins , predominately <extra_id_0> CD11b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and to a lesser extent , <extra_id_0> CD11c <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Cells stimulated with fibrinogen ( 10-100 microg / ml ) / Mn2+ ( 50 microM ) for 2 h were examined by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
NF-kappa B activation , minimal in unstimulated cells , was substantially up-regulated by fibrinogen .
Fibrinogen also caused activation of AP-1 , but not <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or cAMP response element - binding protein ( CREB ) factors .

text: To determine the effects on transcriptional regulation , U937 cells were transfected with a plasmid containing the HIV-1 enhancer ( bearing two NF-kappa B sites ) coupled to a <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) reporter .

text: We conclude that contact with fibrinogen - derived proteins may contribute to mononuclear phagocyte activation by signaling through <extra_id_0> CD11b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , resulting in selective activation of transcriptional regulatory factors , including NF-kappa B .
